A 'diplomatic mission' is a group of people from one state or an international
inter-governmental organisation (such as the United Nations) present in another
state to represent the sending state/organisation officially in the receiving
state. In practice, a diplomatic mission usually denotes the 'resident mission',
namely the office of a country's diplomatic representatives in the capital city
of another country. As well as being a diplomatic mission to the country in
which it is situated, it may also be a non-resident permanent mission to one or
more other countries. There are thus resident and non-resident embassies. [-
